meanings.definition: an area in southeastern Wales that was a county (= an area with its own local government) from 1974 to 1996:
examples: We live in Newport, Gwent.
He married a woman from Gwent.

meanings.definition: an area in northwestern Wales that has its own local government. From 1974 to 1996 it was part of a larger area, including the Isle of Anglesey, also called Gwynedd:
examples: The couple live in a cottage at Foulkeways in Gwynedd, Wales.
Edward is a hill farmer from Gwynedd.

meanings.definition: written abbreviation for gray: a unit of measurement for absorbed radiation
a place or club where you can go to exercise using machines, weights, and other equipment:
examples: I go to the gym twice a week.
You should join a gym.

meanings.definition: a large room with equipment for exercising the body and increasing strength, or space for playing sport:
examples: We played basketball in the gym.

meanings.definition: physical exercises and activities performed inside, often using equipment, especially when done as a subject at school:
examples: gym clothes
gym shoes
Class 3 do gym on a Wednesday afternoon.
The third graders have gym on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

meanings.definition: short form ofgymnasium:
examples: I work out at the gym every day.

meanings.definition: physical education:
examples: We have gym after recess.

meanings.definition: someone who spends a lot of time exercising in the gym, and who cares very much about the shape and condition of their body:
examples: Most of us are not models or gym bunnies.

meanings.definition: someone who spends a lot of time exercising in the gym, and who cares very much about the shape and condition of their body:
examples: "I was one of those gym rats working out hour after hour," she said.

meanings.definition: a flat shoe with a rubber sole, worn for sports, especially indoor sports
a light, comfortable shoe that is suitable for sports or informal wear
an event at which people ride horses, taking part in various competitions involving horse racing and jumping over special fences
a large room with equipment for exercising the body and increasing strength, or space for playing sport, especially in a school:
examples: The dance classes were held in a high school gymnasium .
The top floor contains a gymnasium and basketball court.

meanings.definition: a school in Germany, Austria, the Netherlands and some other countries that prepares children for university:
examples: She spent a year at a gymnasium in Heidelburg, Germany.
A science teacher at Spanga Gymnasium in Stockholm, Sweden did a collaborative project with a twin school in Madagascar.

meanings.definition: a building or room designed and equipped for various sports, physical training, and exercise
a person who is skilled in gymnastics, often someone who competes in gymnastic competitions:
examples: a great Russian gymnast

meanings.definition: a person who is skilled at performing controlled physical exercises, often on special equipment, sometimes in sports competitions

relating to gymnastics (= physical exercises and activities performed inside, often using equipment such as bars and ropes, intended to increase the body's strength and the ability to move and bend easily):
examples: a gymnastic display
Olga Corbett became famous after her inspirational gymnastic routines in the 1972 Olympics.

meanings.definition: in a way that relates to or is similar to gymnastics (= physical exercises and activities performed inside, often using equipment such as bars and ropes, intended to increase the body's strength and the ability to move and bend easily):
examples: His daughter is gymnastically talented and can do a handstand for over a minute.
The cheerleading routine requires the team to perform some gymnastically challenging moves.

meanings.definition: physical exercises and activities performed inside, often using equipment such as bars and ropes, intended to increase the body's strength and the ability to move and bend easily:
examples: I do gymnastics after school on Fridays.
She won several medals in the gymnastics.
the US women's gymnastics team

meanings.definition: the ability to think, speak, sing, etc. quickly and cleverly, especially while changing what you are thinking, saying, or singing many times:
examples: His verbal gymnastics while trying to avoid answering the question were astonishing.
We all admired the singer's vocal gymnastics.
I'd like to handle my own financial affairs without having to do mental gymnastics.

meanings.definition: physical exercises that increase the body’s strength, balance, and ability to move gracefully, often using special equipment, or the competitive sport of performing such exercises
any plant of a group of plants that produce seeds but no flowers, including conifers and cycads:
examples: Gymnosperms grow only from seeds without the protective case.
Plant life was mainly primitive gymnosperms, with ferns and conifers dominant.
It's a deciduous gymnosperm, originally from China.

meanings.definition: a plain dress without sleeves usually worn over a shirt, especially in the past, by girls as a part of their school uniform
relating to gynaecology (= the area of medicine concerned with disorders and functions of women's reproductive organs):
examples: gynaecological surgery
gynaecological problems

meanings.definition: a doctor skilled in the treatment of women's diseases, especially those of the reproductive organs
the area of medicine that involves the treatment of women's diseases, especially those of the reproductive organs
the development of breast tissue in men:
examples: Gynaecomastia is usually harmless but emotionally upsetting.

meanings.definition: used to describe the rounded pelvis (= the bones that form the bowl-shaped structure below the waist, at the top of the legs) of human females:
examples: The gynecoid pelvis is thought to be the most favourable pelvis type for a vaginal birth.
Gynecoid obesity, where fat is distributed to thighs and buttocks, is associated with pregnancy.

meanings.definition: relating to gynecology (= the area of medicine concerned with disorders and functions of women's reproductive organs):
examples: gynecological surgery
gynecological problems

meanings.definition: a doctor skilled in the treatment of women's diseases, especially those of the reproductive organs
a doctor who specializes in gynecology
the area of medicine that involves the treatment of women's diseases, especially those of the reproductive organs
the area of medicine that deals with women’s physical health and a woman's ability to reproduce
the development of breast tissue in men:
examples: Gynecomastia is usually harmless but emotionally upsetting.

meanings.definition: having women as the most important or central part, or only involving or dealing with women:
examples: The cable channel is known for showing mostly gynocentric legal dramas and romantic comedies.
The class syllabus is mostly gynocentric, with all but one text written by a woman.

meanings.definition: a Japanese food consisting of meat or vegetables wrapped in dough (= flour and water mixed together) and fried in oil:
examples: We had Japanese gyoza to start.

meanings.definition: pain or trouble:
examples: My knee has been giving me gyp since I started running.

meanings.definition: to cheat someone:
examples: I think the taxpayers are getting gypped.

meanings.definition: to cheat someone:
examples: I think the taxpayers are getting gypped.

meanings.definition: a plant with many small white or pink flowers:
examples: White gypsophila is popularly used as a wedding flower.
Gypsophila plants produce abundant sprays of tiny delicate flowers on long stems.

meanings.definition: a hard, white substance that is used in making plaster of Paris
a member of a race of people originally from northern India who typically used to travel from place to place, and now live especially in Europe and North America:
examples: a gypsy caravan/encampment

meanings.definition: a member of a group of people who travel from place to place esp. in Europe and who originally came from northern India, or anyone who travels often and does not live in one place for long
a type of moth (= an insect similar to a butterfly) whose caterpillars (= the young forms of the moth) cause a lot of damage to trees:
examples: To control gypsy moths, the state uses a bacterial insecticide.
Gypsy moth caterpillars are especially fond of oak leaves.

meanings.definition: to turn around and around on a fixed point, usually quickly
to dance, especially in a sexual way:
examples: A line of male dancers gyrated to the music while the audience screamed their appreciation.

meanings.definition: (of prices, markets, etc.) to change quickly and often:
examples: As the markets gyrated, they rushed to hedge themselves against further currency swings.
The world's currencies are gyrating wildly as fears grow about economic imbalances.

meanings.definition: to swing repeatedly around a fixed point:
examples: She recites a poem while a dancer gyrates next to her.

meanings.definition: the act of turning around and around on a fixed point:
examples: Push your hips back and forth and avoid circular gyration.

meanings.definition: the act of dancing, especially in a sexual way:
examples: It was a night of endless dancing and gyration.
Mata Hari electrified countless stages with her free-spirited gyrations.

meanings.definition: the act of repeatedly and quickly changing:
examples: Some regions may experience housing price gyrations.
Management intentionally smoothed out gyrations in earnings to show investors it was a low-risk company.

meanings.definition: a circular pattern of ocean currents (= flows of water in a particular direction):
examples: The area is one of the world’s five major ocean gyres – huge systems of rotating currents.

meanings.definition: a circular movement in which each circle is above, below, or wider than the one before:
examples: The hawk wheels in a widening gyre.

meanings.definition: to move in circles:
examples: He liked to sketch gyring vultures.

meanings.definition:
plural of 
        
         gyrus   specialized
a gyroscope
a food consisting of pitta bread filled with lamb and vegetables
a device containing a wheel that spins freely within a frame, used on aircraft and ships to help keep them horizontal, and as a children's toy
with the use of a gyroscope (= a device containing a wheel that spins freely within a frame, used on aircraft, ships, etc. to help keep them horizontal):
examples: The roller coaster was mounted with a gyroscopically stable camera that remained steady as the ride went around turns and loops.
The security guard does patrols around the premises on a gyroscopically balanced motorised scooter.

meanings.definition: one of the many rounded raised parts on the surface of the brain
